verses.verse: And it came to pass<WH3068>, when Jehovah would take up<WH5927> Elijah<WH452> by a whirlwind<WH5591> into heaven<WH8064>, that Elijah<WH452> went<WH3212> with Elisha<WH477> from Gilgal<WH1537>.

And Elijah<WH452> said<WH559> unto Elisha<WH477>, Tarry<WH3427> here<WH3068>, I pray thee; for Jehovah hath sent<WH7971> me as far as Beth-el<WH1008>. And Elisha<WH477> said<WH559>, As Jehovah<WH3068> liveth<WH2416>, and as thy soul<WH5315> liveth<WH2416>, I will not leave<WH5800> thee<WH3381>. So they went down to Beth-el<WH1008>.

And the sons<WH1121> of the prophets<WH5030> that were at Beth-el<WH1008> came forth<WH3318> to Elisha<WH477>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH3045>, Knowest thou that Jehovah<WH3068> will take away<WH3947> thy master<WH113> from thy head<WH7218> to-day<WH3117>? And he said<WH559>, Yea<WH3045>, I know it<WH2814>; hold ye your peace.

And Elijah<WH452> said<WH559> unto him<WH477>, Elisha, tarry<WH3427> here<WH3068>, I pray thee; for Jehovah hath sent<WH7971> me to Jericho<WH3405>. And he said<WH559>, As Jehovah<WH3068> liveth<WH2416>, and as thy soul<WH5315> liveth<WH2416>, I will not leave<WH5800> thee<WH935>. So they came to Jericho<WH3405>.

And the sons<WH1121> of the prophets<WH5030> that were at Jericho<WH3405> came<WH5066> near to Elisha<WH477>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH3045>, Knowest thou that Jehovah<WH3068> will take away<WH3947> thy master<WH113> from thy head<WH7218> to-day<WH3117>? And he answered<WH559>, Yea<WH3045>, I know it<WH2814>; hold ye your peace.

And Elijah<WH452> said<WH559> unto him<WH3427>, Tarry here<WH3068>, I pray thee; for Jehovah hath sent<WH7971> me to the Jordan<WH3383>. And he said<WH559>, As Jehovah<WH3068> liveth<WH2416>, and as thy soul<WH5315> liveth<WH2416>, I will not leave<WH5800> thee<WH8147>. And they two went on<WH3212>.

And fifty<WH2572> men<WH376> of the sons<WH1121> of the prophets<WH5030> went<WH1980>, and stood<WH5975> over against<WH5048> them afar off<WH7350>: and they two<WH8147> stood<WH5975> by the Jordan<WH3383>.

And Elijah<WH452> took<WH3947> his mantle<WH155>, and wrapped it together<WH1563>, and smote<WH5221> the waters<WH4325>, and they were divided<WH2673> hither and thither<WH8147>, so that they two went over<WH5674> on dry ground<WH2724>.

And it came to pass<WH5674>, when they were gone over, that Elijah<WH452> said<WH559> unto Elisha<WH477>, Ask<WH7592> what I shall do<WH6213> for thee<WH3947>, before I am taken from thee<WH477>. And Elisha said<WH559>, I pray thee<WH8147>, let a double portion<WH6310> of thy spirit be upon me<WH7307>.
And he said<WH559>, Thou hast asked<WH7592> a hard thing<WH7185>: nevertheless<WH7200>, if thou see me when I am taken from thee<WH3947>, it shall be so unto thee; but if not, it shall not be so.

And it came to pass<WH1980>, as they still went on<WH1980>, and talked<WH1696>, that<WH7393>, behold, there appeared a chariot of fire<WH784>, and horses<WH5483> of fire<WH784>, which parted<WH6504> them both<WH8147> asunder<WH996>; and Elijah<WH452> went up<WH5927> by a whirlwind<WH5591> into heaven<WH8064>.

And Elisha<WH477> saw<WH7200> it<WH6817>, and he cried, My father<WH1>, my father<WH1>, the chariots<WH7393> of Israel<WH3478> and the horsemen<WH6571> thereof<WH7200>! And he saw him no more<WH2388>: and he took hold of his own clothes<WH899>, and rent<WH7167> them in two<WH8147> pieces<WH7168>.
He took up<WH7311> also the mantle<WH155> of Elijah<WH452> that fell<WH5307> from him<WH7725>, and went back, and stood<WH5975> by the bank<WH8193> of the Jordan<WH3383>.

And he took<WH3947> the mantle<WH155> of Elijah<WH452> that fell<WH5307> from him<WH5221>, and smote the waters<WH4325>, and said<WH559>, Where is Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of Elijah<WH452>? and when he also had smitten<WH5221> the waters<WH4325>, they were divided<WH2673> hither and thither<WH477>; and Elisha went over<WH5674>.

And when the sons<WH1121> of the prophets<WH5030> that were at Jericho<WH3405> over against him saw<WH7200> him<WH559>, they said, The spirit<WH7307> of Elijah<WH452> doth rest<WH5117> on Elisha<WH477>. And they came<WH935> to meet<WH7125> him<WH7812>, and bowed themselves to the ground before him<WH776>.

And they said<WH559> unto him<WH3426>, Behold now, there are with thy servants<WH5650> fifty<WH2572> strong<WH2428> men<WH1121>; let them go<WH3212>, we pray thee<WH1245>, and seek thy master<WH113>, lest the Spirit<WH7307> of Jehovah<WH3068> hath taken him up<WH5375>, and cast<WH7993> him upon some<WH259> mountain<WH2022>, or into some<WH259> valley<WH1516>. And he said<WH559>, Ye shall not send<WH7971>.

And when they urged<WH6484> him till he was ashamed<WH954>, he said<WH559>, Send<WH7971>. They sent<WH7971> therefore fifty<WH2572> men<WH376>; and they sought<WH1245> three<WH7969> days<WH3117>, but found him not<WH4672>.
And they came back<WH7725> to him<WH3427>, while he tarried at Jericho<WH3405>; and he said<WH559> unto them<WH559>, Did I not say unto you<WH3212>, Go not?

And the men<WH582> of the city<WH5892> said<WH559> unto Elisha<WH477>, Behold<WH4186>, we pray thee, the situation of this city<WH5892> is pleasant<WH2896>, as my lord<WH113> seeth<WH7200>: but the water<WH4325> is bad<WH7451>, and the land<WH776> miscarrieth<WH7921>.
And he said<WH559>, Bring<WH3947> me a new<WH2319> cruse<WH6746>, and put<WH7760> salt<WH4417> therein<WH3947>. And they brought it to him.

And he went forth<WH3318> unto the spring<WH4161> of the waters<WH4325>, and cast<WH7993> salt<WH4417> therein<WH559>, and said, Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, I have healed<WH7495> these waters<WH4325>; there shall not be from thence any more death<WH4194> or miscarrying<WH7921>.
So the waters<WH4325> were healed<WH7495> unto this day<WH3117>, according to the word<WH1697> of Elisha<WH477> which he spake<WH1696>.

And he went up<WH5927> from thence unto Beth-el<WH1008>; and as he was going up<WH5927> by the way<WH1870>, there came forth<WH3318> young<WH6996> lads<WH5288> out of the city<WH5892>, and mocked<WH7046> him<WH559>, and said unto him<WH5927>, Go up, thou baldhead<WH7142>; go up<WH5927>, thou baldhead<WH7142>.

And he looked<WH7200> behind<WH310> him and saw<WH7200> them<WH7043>, and cursed them in the name<WH8034> of Jehovah<WH3068>. And there came forth<WH3318> two<WH8147> she-bears<WH1677> out of the wood<WH3293>, and tare<WH1234> forty<WH705> and two<WH8147> lads of them<WH3206>.
And he went<WH3212> from thence to mount<WH2022> Carmel<WH3760>, and from thence he returned<WH7725> to Samaria<WH8111>.
